displaytitle: Two studies of woman, with right hand on hip
medium: Pen and brown ink over black crayon
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895
markings: Stamp in black ink, on verso lower left: D.F.P. [in circle] [Lugt 750a]
signed: Initialed in black chalk, lower center: CP

titles.title: Two Studies of Female Figure with Head Turned, Right Hand on Hip

makers.displaydate: 1830–1903; born Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands, died Paris, France
makers.displaymaker: Camille Pissarro, 1830–1903; born Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands, died Paris, France

texts.textentryhtml: Pissarro was a prolific printmaker and avid draftsman, sketching incessantly to quickly capture, in a few simple lines, the characteristic gestures and dress of people working in the fields and marketplaces of Normandy. The artist used these drawings, collected in small sketchbooks and pads, as reference material for his paintings and prints, in which figures in favored poses sometimes reappear multiple times in various compositions over many years.

bibliography.boilertext: Christopher Lloyd, "Camille Pissarro at Princeton," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 41, no. 1 (1982): p. 2–13.
bibliography.citation: Christopher Lloyd, "Camille Pissarro at Princeton," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 41, no. 1 (1982): p. 2–13., fig. 2, p. 4 (illus)
